The city of Olsztyn was founded in
1353 by the Teutonic Knights.
Teutonic Knights were a
religious military order
originally founded to protect pilgrims in the Holy Land.
But once the Holy Land fell,
the Teutonic Knights moved northwards,
and they made their way to the Prussia region on the Baltic Sea.
It was reverted to Polish control in the mid 1400s,
but statues like this were the reason the Teutonic Knights came here.
This statue is from pre- Christianity.
